title: dataviz
text: Our team transforms complex housing data into clear, compelling visual formats that make information accessible to diverse audiences. We create interactive dashboards, infographics, maps, and charts that highlight key patterns and relationships in housing markets and needs. Our visualization work supports both strategic planning and public communication, helping stakeholders understand housing trends and their implications. We specialize in presenting technical information in ways that resonate with non-technical audiences, using visualization techniques that reveal insights that might be missed in traditional data presentations.

title: program
text: We provide comprehensive support for launching new housing programs and assessing the effectiveness of existing initiatives. Our implementation services include creating operational procedures, training staff, developing marketing strategies, and establishing monitoring systems. Our evaluations combine process and outcome measures to determine whether programs are achieving their goals efficiently and equitably. We identify specific recommendations for program refinement based on performance data and stakeholder feedback. Our approach emphasizes continuous improvement rather than one-time assessment, creating systems that allow programs to adapt to changing conditions and incorporate new learning.

title: assessments
text: Our comprehensive housing needs assessments combine quantitative data analysis with qualitative research to provide a nuanced understanding of local housing challenges and opportunities. We analyze demographic trends, housing market conditions, and economic indicators while gathering input from residents, service providers, and other stakeholders. Our assessments include detailed gap analyses that identify specific housing needs by income level, household type, and special populations. We translate technical findings into clear recommendations for housing production targets, policy changes, and program investments that respond to identified needs and market realities.

title: capacity
text: HDAdvisors develops innovative housing programs and policies tailored to specific community needs and market conditions. We identify best practices from across the country and adapt them to local contexts, ensuring that new initiatives build on proven models while responding to unique local circumstances. Our design process incorporates input from multiple stakeholders and addresses implementation considerations from the outset. We create detailed program guidelines, application materials, and evaluation frameworks that support efficient administration while achieving intended outcomes. Our approach emphasizes programs that are financially sustainable, administratively feasible, and responsive to evolving community needs.

title: research
text: We conduct targeted research on specific housing topics that combines rigorous academic methods with practical applications. Our research projects include literature reviews, case studies of best practices, program evaluations, and policy analyses tailored to specific community contexts. We design research methodologies that balance quantitative and qualitative approaches to provide holistic understanding of complex housing challenges. Our findings are presented in accessible formats that bridge the gap between academic research and practical implementation, giving clients actionable information to guide decision-making.

title: HDAdvisors
text:
Eric Mai

Vice President
Eric has worked in the field of research for over a decade. Before entering the affordable housing industry, Eric worked as a field archaeologist in the Mid-Atlantic for six years. He received his Masters of Archaeology and Heritage Management from the University of Leicester and later his Masters in Urban and Regional Planning from Virginia Commonwealth University. 
His interdisciplinary background in art history, archaeology, and urban planning brings a distinctive perspective to affordable housing policy and research. Studying how communities throughout history designed and adapted their living spaces has given him unique insights into sustainable urban development and community-centered housing solutions. This historical lens enhances his approach to modern housing challenges, allowing me to identify time-tested patterns in how successful communities balance density, affordability, and quality of life.
Eric currently serves on nonprofit affordable housing boards, including RVA CDC and Commonwealth Catholic Charities Housing Corporation.

title: Your First Blog Post
text: Welcome to the HDAdvisors blog! This is where we’ll share insights on affordable housing trends, policy research, and data visualization.

title: Your First Blog Post
text:
Example R Code

Codelibrary(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)

# Sample data - replace with your actual data
housing_data <- data.frame(
  year = 2015:2025,
  median_price = c(220000, 230000, 245000, 260000, 275000, 
                  292000, 325000, 375000, 400000, 410000, 415000)
)

# Create a visualization
ggplot(housing_data, aes(x = year, y = median_price)) +
  geom_line(color = "#2C3E50", size = 1.2) +
  geom_point(color = "#E74C3C", size = 3) +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::dollar) +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    title = "Richmond Area Housing Price Trends",
    subtitle = "Median home prices have nearly doubled over the past decade",
    x = "Year",
    y = "Median Price"
  )

title: HDAdvisors
text:
HDAdvisors (HDA) is a collaboration of experienced community development professionals launched in 2006. HDA provides housing-related consulting services to non-profits, housing authorities, local governments, lenders, and other community development organizations. HDA is led by Erica Sims, who has spent 20 years in affordable development as both a developer and consultant.
HDA provides feasibility, financial and development consulting services for affordable housing and other community development projects. HDA is unique because its principals have spent decades as the heads of for-profit and non-profit development corporations and policy organizations in multiple states, building new construction and rehabilitation projects for affordable housing.
This experience gives us an intimate knowledge of federal and local housing programs and what “works” and what does not. This development experience enables HDA to understand housing policy from the perspective of a practitioner in the private sector, to assist clients in creating projects that are workable in the real world. Our work includes: ​

title: HDAdvisors
text:
Erica Sims

President
Erica has worked in the non-profit management, affordable housing development, and community organizing fields for over 20 years. Her focus has been social and economic justice through housing and economic development. Ms. Sims has held private sector, nonprofit, and government roles and has overseen the development of over 2,500 units of affordable housing and 50,000 square feet of commercial development space in new construction and renovation projects.
Prior to joining HDA in 2017, she was the Deputy Executive Director of Mutual Housing Association of New York, an non-profit affordable housing developer, owner, and manager with a portfolio over 1,500 units of affordable housing. She received a Bachelor’s in Economics and a Bachelor’s in Urban Planning from the University of Michigan and a Masters of Business Administration from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. 
During her tenure at HDAdvisors she served as Maggie Walker Community Land Trust’s CEO, Virginia Statewide Community Land Trust’s CEO and HousingForward’s Co-Executive Director.

title: CLAUDE.md
text:
This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.


This is a website for HDAdvisors, an affordable housing consulting organization. The website is built using Quarto, a publishing system that allows for embedding R, Python, and other executable code with Markdown.




Render the website: quarto render

This compiles all .qmd files to HTML in the docs/ directory
The output directory is configured in _quarto.yml

Preview the website locally: quarto preview

This starts a local server and automatically refreshes when changes are made

Create a new page:

Create a new .qmd file in the root directory
Add the page to the navbar in _quarto.yml if needed






Technology Stack:

Quarto for static site generation
R/RStudio as the development environment
GitHub Pages for hosting (using the docs/ directory)

Content Structure:

Each page is defined by a .qmd file in the root directory
The site configuration is in _quarto.yml
The site is styled using the Cosmo theme with custom CSS in styles.css

File Organization:

.qmd files: Source content files with Markdown and optional executable code blocks
docs/: Generated HTML site (don’t edit directly)
_quarto.yml: Site configuration (navigation, theme, output settings)

title: management
text: HDAdvisors provides comprehensive program management services for affordable housing initiatives at all scales, from individual projects to organization-wide portfolios. We oversee the full lifecycle of housing programs, establishing clear objectives, detailed work plans, and robust monitoring systems that ensure accountability and measurable outcomes. Our approach combines strategic vision with attention to operational details, allowing us to manage complex initiatives with multiple stakeholders and funding sources. We excel at coordinating cross-functional teams, balancing competing priorities, and adapting to changing circumstances while maintaining focus on core program goals. Our program management services include regular reporting to stakeholders, risk assessment and mitigation strategies, and systems for capturing and applying lessons learned. We bring particular expertise to programs involving multiple partners, helping to clarify roles and responsibilities, establish effective communication channels, and create shared accountability frameworks that support collaborative success.

title: speaking
text: We are go-to experts to talk about affordable housing in Virginia.

title: policy
text: HDAdvisors develops innovative housing programs and policies tailored to specific community needs and market conditions. We identify best practices from across the country and adapt them to local contexts, ensuring that new initiatives build on proven models while responding to unique local circumstances. Our design process incorporates input from multiple stakeholders and addresses implementation considerations from the outset. We create detailed program guidelines, application materials, and evaluation frameworks that support efficient administration while achieving intended outcomes. Our approach emphasizes programs that are financially sustainable, administratively feasible, and responsive to evolving community needs.

title: development
text: Our team guides clients through every phase of the development process, from initial concept to project completion. We assist with site selection, zoning analysis, architectural coordination, construction oversight, and lease-up planning. Drawing on decades of hands-on development experience, we anticipate challenges before they arise and create realistic timelines and budgets that account for the complexities of affordable housing development. Our approach emphasizes long-term sustainability while meeting immediate community needs.
